pullRequest.body:
Since `Submodule.map` requires surjectivity of the RingHom, the new lemmas have to be stated this way. (The RingHom is `frobenius` in my intended application, which is not necessarily surjective.)

---

bors d+

```suggestion
/-- A version of `Submodule.RingHomSurjective` that does not require the `RingHomSurjective`
assumption. -/
theorem image_span_le (f : F) (s : Set M) (N : Submodule R₂ M₂) :
    f '' span R s ≤ N ↔ MapsTo f s N := image_subset_iff.trans <| span_le (p := N.comap f)

theorem image_span_le_span (f : F) (s : Set M) : f '' span R s ≤ span R₂ (f '' s) :=
  (image_span_le f s _).2 fun x hx ↦ subset_span ⟨x, hx, rfl⟩
```
Oh, and these are sets not submodules, so `⊆` should be used instead of `≤` and the name should stay the same.
The issue is that if the RingHom isn't surjective then the image is not necessarily a submodule.

Yes I realise this!

FWIW here's what happened at my end:
 1. These are submodules, they should use `≤`, I'll suggest that!
 2. Wait, shouldn't these be stated with `Submodule.map`? Oh I see: without the required surjectivity this is a statement about sets. This is slightly subtle so I'll suggest adding a comment.
 
except that I missed out on:
 3. Realise that step 1 no longer applies, so I should remove my suggestion from step 1.

```suggestion
    map f (span R s) ≤ N ↔ MapsTo f s N := image_span_subset f s N
```
This isn't syntactically the same because N will be coerced to a set. ~~I'll apply the suggestion if you do prefer it.~~ I prefer not changing the existing spelling.

I can't make a strong argument either way. I like using `MapsTo` because it has a useful API, but there are plenty of places in the linear algebra library where we use the spelling you propose; do as you prefer.
Note that I didn't change the statement of this lemma, so it's not my proposal. Anyway this PR is not for changing existing statements, and that should probably be discussed on Zulip ...

```suggestion
/-- A version of `Submodule.map_span_le` that does not require the `RingHomSurjective`
```
Clearly I had not had enough coffee this morning.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add `Submodule.image_span_subset(_span)` and golf
